Articles.Content:
Just goes to show myself and maybe others. That not all moons you will need wheels. At leas this is true for Minmus so far.

Did try to use an Ion Drive. But, a single one does not give enough push. But, will put that one around Kerbin for December. =^.^=

Edit: Well since I have no idea on how long it takes to get accepted at the space port. I'll use my website to speed up the process. Just save target as or open the link then cut and past the text to a new text doc. Just did not feel like zipping it.

http://aragosnat.webs.com/Sleigh%20Ant.craft

http://aragosnat.webs.com/Sleigh%20Ion.craft

Edited June 9, 2013 by Aragosnat
I'd still rather have wheels... But this is quite inventive. :]
Oh you people want it? I'll put it into my first post then. When I can.

I'd still rather have wheels... But this is quite inventive. :]

You might find wheels arent the best thing ever for minmus, theres too little grip
Too little grip due to low gravity. But, anyways. If anyone wants to try them out. I posted the links. Wish it was the SpacePort. Just waiting for approval.

Oh you people want it? I'll put it into my first post then. When I can.

Thanks! I tried making 1 but it's a pathetic pile of I-Beams and fuel.

Try putting this on Gilly. Will provide an interesting experience. Low gravity means low surface drag and friction (same thing, sort of), and maybe you can use an ion engine. If it's not flat enough, you can try Pol.

@Naten: Might try it when I get the chance to and I do have an Ion engine as that was my first attempt and was to lazy to remove the panels from the ant version. Thank all to those who tried it out. Wish the other site would accept my craft file. But, they just plain hate me for some reason...
